intro: Hieracium estellatum, commonly known as Estelle's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, while its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium estellatum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
